params._staker: Address for which to calculated rewards.

multicall(bytes[]).details: Receives and executes a batch of function calls on this contract.

params.data: The bytes data that makes up the batch of function calls to execute.

returns.results: The bytes data that makes up the result of the batch of function calls executed.

setContractURI(string).details: Caller should be authorized to setup contractURI, e.g. contract admin.                  See {_canSetContractURI}.                  Emits {ContractURIUpdated Event}.

params._uri: keccak256 hash of the role. e.g. keccak256("TRANSFER_ROLE")

params._newOwner: The address to set as the new owner of the contract.

stake(uint256).details: See {_stake}. Override that to implement custom logic.

withdraw(uint256).details: See {_withdraw}. Override that to implement custom logic.

withdrawRewardTokens(uint256).details: Admin can withdraw excess reward tokens.

getRewardTokenBalance().notice: View total rewards available in the staking contract.

getStakeInfo(address).notice: View amount staked and rewards for a user.

multicall(bytes[]).notice: Receives and executes a batch of function calls on this contract.

owner().notice: Returns the owner of the contract.

setContractURI(string).notice: Lets a contract admin set the URI for contract-level metadata.

setOwner(address).notice: Lets an authorized wallet set a new owner for the contract.

setRewardRatio(uint256,uint256).notice: Set rewards per unit of time.           Interpreted as (numerator/denominator) rewards per second/per day/etc based on time-unit.           For e.g., ratio of 1/20 would mean 1 reward token for every 20 tokens staked.

setTimeUnit(uint80).notice: Set time unit. Set as a number of seconds.           Could be specified as -- x * 1 hours, x * 1 days, etc.
